parameters.name: properties
parameters.description: Sets all key-value pairs in the properties object as widget properties.

description: A `TimeDialog` represents a native dialog pop-up allowing the user to pick a time of day. Properties can only be set before open() is called. The dialog is automatically disposed when closed.

date.description: The time to be displayed in the dialog. The current time is used when no date object is provided.
The selected time. Can be `null` when no date was selected.

close.description: Fired when the time dialog was closed.

date.description: The selected time. Only the time components reflect the users selection. The date component values are undefined.

select.description: Fired when a time was selected by the user.

open.description: Makes the given time dialog visible. Meant to be used with inline-JSX. In TypeScript it also casts the given JSX element from `any` to an actual TimeDialog.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: The time to be displayed in the dialog. The current time is used when no date object is provided.

open.description: Creates and opens a time dialog.
